intro: Gymnocalycium delaetii f. antherosacos, commonly known as the pink-flowered moon cactus, is a unique cactus species characterized by its striking pink or red flowers. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is native to arid regions of South America. The plant features a short, thick stem with a dense covering of spines, and its flowers are typically borne in clusters at the base of the stem. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and containers due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in well-draining soil.
